data.title: Guest List by Announcement Date
data.text:
Announced: 08/27/2024

Sarah Nakamura

Sarah Nakamura transitioned from book enthusiast to Story Consultant for Amazon's The Wheel of Time TV series. She is currently involved in post-production for the highly anticipated third season.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/26/2024

Genevieve Padalecki

Genevieve Padalecki starred in the television series Wildfire as Kris Furillo, appeared as Tracy Stark in FlashForward, and had a recurring role in Supernatural as the demon Ruby.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/24/2024

Camilla Cleese

Camilla Cleese is a writer and comedian. She regularly tours doing stand up comedy and has made television appearances including Comedy Central and AGT.

Sanford Greene

Sanford Greene has worked as a professional illustrator for over 18 years for Marvel, DC, Dark Horse, and Image Comics. He helped reshape Marvel Comics characters Powerman and Iron Fist and illustrated Black Panther and Luke Cage. Greene is a 2-time Eisner and Ringo Award winner for Bitter Root, which is slated to become a film.

Kevin Maguire

Kevin Maguire is an artist/writer/creator primarily known for his 1987 debut series Justice League International with writers Keith Giffen and Marc DeMatteis. From there he was penciller on Adventures Of Captain America, Batman Confidential: The Cat and The Bat, Created Equal, and X-Men Forever with writer Fabian Nicieza.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/23/2024

Don L McGregor

Don McGregor, original writer of Black Panther comic books, has become one of the foremost writers in comic books today. With almost 30 years of experience in the field, McGregor incorporates a deep understanding of human nature into his stories, blending humanity with humility and pain with glory.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/22/2024

Ariel Diaz

Ariel Diaz is a self-taught multimedia artist/illustrator fully devoted to her career. Her unique style has mad a strong and positive impression in the comic industry, with her art being featured in DC and Marvel Comics.

Manny Jacinto

Manuel Jacinto is an actor whose breakout role came as Jason Mendoza on The Good Place. Jacinto had minor roles in Bad Times at the El Royale and Top Gun: Maverick and portrayed Qimir in the Star Wars series The Acolyte. He also provides the voice of Scott Denoga in the Disney Channel and Disney+ animated series Hailey's On It!

Back to Top

Announced: 08/18/2024

Deric A. Hughes

Deric A. Hughes is writer/co-executive producer for NBC’s Quantum Leap, CW’s Legacies, Arrow, The Flash, Beauty & the Beast, and Syfy’s Warehouse 13. Additionally, he was writer/producer for EFE’s webseries, Gemini Division and Afterworld, Virgin comic book series, John Woo’s 7 Brothers, and co-creator for comic book, Living In Infamy, and Renegade.

William Stout

William Stout is an American fantasy artist and illustrator with a specialization in paleontological art. His paintings have been shown in over seventy exhibitions, including twelve one-man shows. He has worked on over thirty feature films, doing everything from storyboard art to production design.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/16/2024

Jeff Brown

Jeff Brown is a professional illustrator and designer from Canada, specializing in epic fantasy and science fiction book covers. His work focuses on an epic scope and giant scale.

Amanda Schull

Amanda Schull is an actor and former professional ballet dancer. She is known for her lead role in Center Stage, and for her recurring roles on One Tree Hill and Pretty Little Liars. She starred as Dr. Cassandra Railly in 12 Monkeys, and played a recurring role on Suits before being promoted to series regular.

Dexter Vines

Native Atlantan Dexter Vines is one of comics' most prolific and well respected artists/inkers with over 25 years of experience. Vines has worked for almost every major comic publisher, including such titles as Superman/Batman, Civil War, and Wolverine: Old Man Logan. His recent projects include Ahsoka and Mace Windu.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/15/2024

Megan Ansdell

Megan Ansdell works at NASA Headquarters as the Habitable Worlds Observatory Program scientist, Mars Sample Return planetary protection lead, and Planetary Science AI/ML lead.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/14/2024

Harvey Guillén

Harvey Guillen is currently one of the leads in the new FX series dark comedy What We Do In The Shadows. Guillen previously appeared in The Magicians, Eye Candy, Huge, Little America, Room 104, The Good Place, Raising Hope, and more.

Kayvan Novak

Kayvan Novak is an actor and comedian who co-created and starred in the comedy series Fonejacker and Facejacker, winning the BAFTA Television Award for Best Comedy in 2008. He also portrayed Waj in the comedy film Four Lions, Nandor the Relentless in the mockumentary series What We Do in the Shadows, and Fabian Kingsworth in Archer.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/13/2024

Lori Glaze

Dr. Lori Glaze is the acting deputy associate administrator for NASA's Exploration Systems Development Mission Directorate. Her interests include volcanology, atmospheric transport and diffusion processes, and geologic mass movements.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/11/2024

Shane Gries

Shane Gries is a retired US Army Colonel. He spent over 18 years posted overseas in Europe, Asia, and Oceania, and can order beer in several languages. He has seven published novels and two short stories.

Emily Hampshire

Emily Hampshire is best known for roles including Angelina in Boy Meets Girl, Vivienne in Snow Cake, Jennifer Goines in the Syfy drama series 12 Monkeys, and Stevie Budd in the comedy series Schitt's Creek, as well as the voice role of Misery in the animated series Ruby Gloom.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/09/2024

Billy Boyd

Billy Boyd is a Scottish actor and musician most widely known for playing the character Peregrin "Pippin" Took in the film adaptations of The Lord of the Rings and Barret Bonden in Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World.

Orson Scott Card

Orson Scott Card is the author of the novels Ender's Game, Ender's Shadow, and Speaker for the Dead. His more recent series include the young adult Pathfinder series, the fantasy Mithermages series, and the Side Step series. The long awaited conclusion to the Ender series, The Last Shadow, was published in 2021.

Bruce Horak

Bruce Horak is a Canadian artist and television and stage actor, known for portraying Hemmer on Star Trek: Strange New Worlds.

Dominic Monaghan

Widely known for his role in the Lord of the Rings trilogy, you might also know him as Charlie from the iconic series Lost, Chris Bradley aka Bolt in X-Men Origins: Wolverine, or as Beaumont in Star Wars, along with award winning podcasts and dozens of cameos in series and films.

Kat Pleviak

Kat Pleviak is the founder and Artistic Director of Sea Beast Puppet Company. She produces the Puppet Meltdown Puppet Slam and created The Shadow Puppet Conspiracy.

Elijah Wood

Elijah Wood is an actor and producer known for his portrayal of Frodo Baggins in The Lord of the Rings film trilogy and The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey. Wood can also be seen in Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, Sin City, Wilfred, and Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/08/2024

J.E. Schleicher

John Eric “J. E.” Schleicher is an award winning author who writes stories that leave behind a fantastical aftertaste long after reading. His short fiction has appeared in various publications.

Tom Vandermolen

Tom Vandermolen is an award winning author of science fiction and horror stories. He lives in Seattle, but you can find him online at https://tomvandermolen.com

Back to Top

Announced: 08/07/2024

Courtenay Taylor

Psychotic biotic? Check. Conflicted Jedi? Check. Elusive and sexy spy? Check and check! That's right; Jack from Mass Effect, Juhani from Knights of the Old Republic, and Ada Wong of Resident Evil 6 all share the same vocal chords of actress Courtenay Taylor!

Back to Top

Announced: 08/06/2024

Vincent D'Onofrio

Vincent D'Onofrio is a legendary actor and filmmaker. His credits include Full Metal Jacket, The Whole Wide World, Men in Black, Men in Black: The Series, The Cell, Law & Order: Criminal Intent, and Jurassic World. He has recently been seen playing Wilson Fisk/Kingpin in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/05/2024

Dwayne Cameron

Globally, Dwayne Cameron is best known for playing the role of Tyzonn the Mercury Power Ranger in Power Rangers: Operation Overdrive and also guest-starring in Power Rangers: S.P.D and Power Rangers: DinoThunder. He will be appearing in the J & J Collectibles booth 2527/2529 of the Vendor Hall.

John Scalzi

John Scalzi is the New York Times bestselling, Hugo, and Dragon Award winning author of Old Man's War, Starter Villain, and other books.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/04/2024

Glenn Parris

Dr. Glenn Parris is the medical director of Parris and Associates Rheumatology. He writes sci-fi, fantasy, and crime thrillers including Dragon's Heir and many others.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/03/2024

Kevin Clash

Kevin Clash is a puppeteer, producer, and director known for performing Elmo from 1979-2012, as well as Splinter (TMNT), Baby Sinclair (Dinosaurs), and Clifford (Muppets Tonight). Credits include Labyrinth, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Happy Time Murders, The Dark Crystal: Age of Resistance, and Fraggle Rock: Back to the Rock.

Darkshift

Combining my love for electronic music and coding, I am also delving into the exciting realm of shaders to create captivating performance visuals and enhance my live shows as a VJ.

Ben Durocher

Ben Durocher is an actor, puppeteer, and puppet builder for Jim Henson Company with credits Fraggle Rock: Back to the Rock, Helpsters, and Pineapple Playhouse and upcoming Dying For Sex and Mr. Crocket. Durocher has completed 1300+ performances in Avenue Q off-Broadway and performed in Madame Butterfly. He is a two-time Emmy Award winning puppet wrangler on Sesame Street.

Frenchy and the Punk

Frenchy and the Punk is the eclectic New York post-punk, dark alternative duo with a French born singer and veteran punk rock guitarist. With sultry powerful vocals and live looped raucous guitar riffs, they were named top 25 duos in America by Yahoo Music.

Nicole Goldman

Nicole Goldman oversees marketing and live events for The Jim Henson Company, launching brands like Fraggle Rock: Back to the Rock, The Dark Crystal: Age of Resistance, Puppet Up! – Uncensored, and Farscape. Productions include Jim Henson's Inspired Silliness, Uni-Verse: A Dark Crystal Odyssey, and the new Fraggle Rock stage show.

Donna Kimball

Donna Kimball plays Mokey in Fraggle Rock: Back to the Rock and voiced Aughra in Dark Crystal Age of Resistance. Other credits include Happytime Murders, Word Party, Sid the Science Kid, and Doc Ock's badass upper right claw in Spider-Man 2. Donna co-created GLOP: The Glorious Ladies of Puppetry.

LDOD

Lips Down On Dixie is an Atlanta based Rocky Horror Picture Show cast which performs weekly Friday midnight shows at The Plaza Theater. Known nationally for their screen accuracy, the cast has made appearances at venues around the Southeast region including Masquerade, Club Future, Chamber, Tongue & Groove, and others.

Jordan Lockhart

Jordan Lockhart is a Sesame Workshop trained puppeteer and writer whose work has appeared on Apple TV+, Netflix, Nickelodeon and TVOKids. Some of his credits include Jim Henson's Fraggle Rock: Back to the Rock, The Barbarian and the Troll, Canada Crew, and the preschool hit Hi Opie!, earning him two Canadian Screen Award nominations.

Paul Mercer

Paul Mercer is a pioneer in neoclassical music who has played the violin since the age of eight. His studies in classical and Hindustani music, decades of busking, playing in bands, managing a violin shop, and travelling have created a unique style combining centuries-old instruments and modern electronic effects.

Frank Meschkuleit

On the original Fraggle Rock, Frank Meschkuleit performed Junior Gorg, and more recently puppeteered Boober Fraggle, Large Marvin, World's Oldest Fraggle, Pa Gorg, and Traveling Matt on the new Fraggle Rock: Back to the Rock. Other credits include Star Trek: SNW, Guillermo del Toro's Frankenstein, Chucky, AVP 2, Toopy & Binoo, Fargo, and The Santa Clause.

Karen Prell

Karen Prell puppeteered Red Fraggle on the original Fraggle Rock TV series and on Fraggle Rock: Back to the Rock, currently streaming on AppleTV+. She performed on many other Jim Henson productions for over 40 years and has also worked as a computer animator for Pixar, Disney, and Valve.

John Tartaglia

John Tartaglia is an acclaimed actor, director, writer, and puppeteer. Known for originating both Rod and Princeton in Broadway's Avenue Q, he currently performs Gobo, Architect, Gunge, Barry Blueberry, and Sprocket in Apple TV+'s Fraggle Rock: Back to the Rock, for which he also writes, directs, and executive produces.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/02/2024

Natasha Liu Bordizzo

Natasha Liu Bordizzo is known for her role of Snow Vase in Netflix's Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon: Sword of Destiny. She portrayed the character of Helena in The Society and Heather in Day Shift. In 2023, she portrayed Mandalorian warrior Sabine Wren in the Disney+ series Ahsoka.

Ming Chen

Ming Chen is most well known for being one of the stars of AMC's Comic Book Men as well as a longtime collaborator of filmmaker Kevin Smith. He can most recently be seen in Clerks III and is the unofficial mayor of The Clermont Lounge in Atlanta.

Seth Green

Seth Green is an actor known for Buffy the Vampire Slayer and comedy films like Idle Hands and the Austin Power film series. Fans may recognize his voice from the Marvel Cinematic Universe, Family Guy, Mass Effect, and more. Green created, directed, wrote, and produced Robot Chicken and its spinoffs.

Paul Jenkins

Paul Jenkins has been creating, writing, and building franchises for over 30 years in the graphic novel, film, and video game industries. Over the last two decades Jenkins has been instrumental in the creation and implementation of literally hundreds of world-renowned, recognizable entertainment icons.

Adrian Pasdar

Adrian Pasdar has established himself as one of the finest and most versatile actors on the scene today. Pasdar has recently appeared on Marvels Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D., the CW's Supergirl, and starred for four seasons on the hit NBC series Heroes.

Patrick Warburton

Patrick Warburton is known to audiences worldwide from his starring roles on Seinfeld, The Tick, NewsRadio, Less Than Perfect, and Rules of Engagement. Voice performances include Kronk on The Emperor's New Groove, Brock Samson on Venture Brothers, Joe Swanson on Family Guy, and Steve Barkin on Kim Possible.

Back to Top

Announced: 08/01/2024

Andy Brase

Andy Brase has done art for many titles including Magic the Gathering (Kaldheim, Midnight Hunt, Lost Caverns of Ixalan), Alien, Predator, Star Wars, Doctor Strange, Punisher, Assassin's Creed, DragonAge, Swamp Thing, Dark Sun, Kull, Spider-Man, Hulk, Daredevil, The Darkness, and more, including book covers for stories by George RR Martin and Neil Gaiman.

Santiago Cabrera

Santiago Cabrera is an actor best known for his roles as Isaac Mendez in Heroes, Lancelot in Merlin, and Aramis in The Musketeers. He was also the lead in Salvation as Darius Tanz and played Captain Cristóbal "Cris" Rios in Star Trek: Picard.

Christina Chong

Christina Chong can be seen in Monroe, Line of Duty, Halo: Nightfall, Black Mirror, Doctor Who, and 24: Live Another Day. She currently plays the role of La'an Noonien-Singh in the series Star Trek: Strange New Worlds.

Devon Eriksen

Devon Eriksen is the acclaimed writer behind Theft of Fire: Orbital Space #1, finalist for both the 2024 Dragon Award for Best Science Fiction Novel and the 2024 Prometheus Award.

Michelle Hurd

Michelle Hurd is known for her television work as Raffi Musiker in Star Trek series Picard, Shepherd in Blindspot, and recurring appearances on Hawaii Five-O, Ash Vs. Evil Dead, Daredevil, and Jessica Jones.

Walter Koenig

Walter Koenig had a recurring role of the quintessential scoundrel Bester on the television series Babylon 5 (1994). He has also appeared on dozens of other television series, including his role as Pavel Chekov in the original Star Trek (1966) series and subsequent movies.

Afua Richardson

Afua Richardson is an American illustrator, author, musician, singer, songwriter, and mentor. In 2007, she made history as one of the first Indigenous Afro-American female artists to work for Marvel Comics as a penciler, inker, and colorist, earning the Nina Simone Award for artistic excellence.

Ming-Na Wen

The diverse actress Ming-Na Wen is best known for her roles in Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. Previously, she has be seen on ER, SGU Stargate Universe, Eureka, and heard as the voice of Mulan. She can most recently be seen playing in The Mandalorian and The Book of Boba Fett.

Back to Top

Announced: 07/31/2024

Erin Gray

Erin Gray is best known for her roles as Kate Summers in the comedy Silver Spoons, Colonel Wilma Deering in the science fiction television series Buck Rogers in the 25th Century, and roles in Six Pack, with Kenny Rogers, and Friday the 13th: Jason Goes to Hell.

Back to Top

Announced: 07/30/2024

Kirk Acevedo

Kirk Acevedo is an American actor primarily known for his work on television for his portrayals of Miguel Alvarez in the HBO series Oz, Joe Toye in Band of Brothers, and FBI Agent Charlie Francis in Fringe. He also portrayed the character of José Ramse on Syfy's 12 Monkeys, as well as villain Ricardo Diaz / The Dragon on The CW's Arrow.

Shiri Appleby

Shiri Appleby is an American actor and television director best known for her leading roles as Liz Parker in the WB/UPN series Roswell and Rachel Goldberg in the Lifetime/Hulu drama series Unreal. Her major film credits include A Time for Dancing, Swimfan, Havoc, Charlie Wilson's War, and The Devil's Candy.

Brittany Bindrim

Dark pop artist and composer Brittany Bindrim released her long-awaited debut album Velella Velella with Metropolis Records this Spring. Already known for her catchy melodies and powerhouse vocal performances in her band, I:Scintilla, Bindrim ventures off into foreign sonic terrains as a solo artist with hard-hitting, edgy tracks.

John Cleese

John Cleese is an English actor, comedian, screenwriter, producer, and presenter. In the late 1960s, he cofounded Monty Python, the comedy troupe responsible for Monty Python's Flying Circus. Cleese starred in the Monty Python films, including Monty Python and the Holy Grail, Life of Brian, and The Meaning of Life.

Mike Colter

Mike Colter is best known for his roles as Lemond Bishop in The Good Wife, Malcolm Ward in Ringer, and Luke Cage in Marvel's Luke Cage, The Defenders, and Jessica Jones, all set in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. He can currently be seen playing David Acosta in the CBS/Paramount+ series Evil.

Powerglove

Video games and speed metal together as one.

Aaron Stanford

Aaron Stanford is an American actor known for his roles as Pyro in X2, X-Men: The Last Stand, and Deadpool & Wolverine, and Doug in the 2006 remake of The Hills Have Eyes. From 2010 to 2013, he starred as Birkhoff in Nikita. He has also starred as James Cole on the television series 12 Monkeys, based on the 1995 film of the same name.

Wasted Wine

Wasted Wine is a Dragon Con veteran of two previous years. We are a four piece acoustic act who sings humorous, dark songs about esoteric topics. Think Danny Elfman meets Gogol Bordello!

Back to Top

Announced: 07/29/2024

Chris Britton

Starting with Scanners (1986), Chris Britton is no stranger to fans of sci-fi/fantasy, whether its Stargate, X-Men: The Animated Series, My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic, The Magicians, Riverdale, Locke & Key, the X-Men '97 TV Series, or DC's Legends of Tomorrow, you will certainly recognize him.

DJ THX

DJ THX has been the DJ for the 10 Forward dance for the last seven years. He brings fun and high energy music to the dance floor. He has been DJing all kinds of events for over 10 years.

Zane Exactly

Shadow Girls Cult, co-founded in 2018 by Cass Bray and Zane Exactly, is a queer shadow puppetry and projections duo based in Seattle, WA.

Mark McDonagh

Mark McDonagh is a physicist and retired Navy submarine force Captain who has been running the National Security Decision Making Game since 1990. He lectures extensively on emerging technology, modern weapons, geopolitical topics, and military history with particular expertise in WWII, the early Cold War, and history of submarine warfare.

Paulette Richards

Independent researcher Dr. Paulette Richards co-curated the Living Objects: African American Puppetry exhibit and wrote Object Performance in the Black Atlantic: The United States.

Back to Top

Announced: 07/28/2024

Phillip Kennedy Johnson

Phillip Kennedy Johnson is an Eisner-nominated writer and musician. He is the writer and co-creator of comic series The Last God, Last Sons of America (currently in development at Netflix), Smoketown, Warlords of Appalachia, Low Road West, and The Lost Boys of the U-Boat Bremen. He has also written Batman, Aquaman, Sinestro, Marvel Zombies: Resurrection, Action Comics, and more.

InHyuk Lee

InHyuk Lee is an illustrator, freelance, and concept artist from Seoul, Korea, who is world renowned for his extraordinary digital artwork. He is currently working with Marvel producing cover illustrations on some of their biggest properties, including Spider-Man, Black Panther, The Incredible Hulk, Wolverine, Venom, The Fantastic Four, and The X-Men.

Jonna Hiestand Mendez

Jonna Mendez is a retired CIA officer who was Chief of Disguise in the CIA's "Q" branch. Her new book is In True Face. She has briefed presidents and prime ministers, and worked with Hollywood's makeup and magic industries. She explains the importance of deception and illusion to CIA.

Back to Top

Announced: 07/26/2024

Tim Bradstreet

Artist and illustrator noted for Shadowrun, Vampire The Masquerade, Hellblazer, The Punisher, Star Trek, Hellraiser, Jennifer Blood, Bad Planet, The Shadow, Pestilence, and many more. His TV/film work includes Blade II, The Punisher, The Walking Dead, The Expanse, and Creepshow. Tim is currently working on Cinematica and Fire Outlook.

Meredith Garretson

Meredith Garretson can currently be seen in the leading role of Kate Hawthorne in Resident Alien. You can also see her portray Ali MacGraw in The Offer. She is also a member of the DC Comics universe, having portrayed Delores Winters on Stargirl on the CW.

Devan Henderson

Devan Henderson is a specialty costumer for film and tv who works on iconic superhero suits. He is also Co-DM of the live actual play podcast D4, alongside Dustin Fletcher.

Anson Mount

Anson Mount is known for his television roles as Cullen Bohannon in the AMC's series Hell on Wheels, Jim Steele on NBC series Conviction, the Marvel Comics superhero Black Bolt in Marvel's Inhumans, and Captain Christopher Pike in season two of Star Trek: Discovery and Star Trek: Strange New Worlds.

Ethan Peck

Actor Ethan Peck is best known for his roles in the movies The Sorcerer's Apprentice and In Time, and the series 10 Things I Hate About You and Star Trek: Discovery. In addition, Peck has lent his voice to Halo 4, Halo 5: Guardians, and Lightning Returns: Final Fantasy XIII.

Cobie Smulders

Cobie Smulders has worked in film, television, stage, and audio narration. Smulders is known for her starring roles as Robin Scherbatsky in How I Met Your Mother, Anne Coulter in American Crime: Impeachment, Simone in High School for Amazon Studios, and most recently Maria Hill in Marvel's series Secret Invasion.

Jamy Ian Swiss

Jamy Ian Swiss is a sleight-of-hand artist, speaker, and author. Television appearances includes The Today Show and The Late, Late Show. Penn and Teller call him, “James Bond with a deck of cards as a pistol!” The New Yorker declared, “Swiss is widely thought to have one of the most masterly sleight-of-hand techniques in the world today.”

Sarah Tomko

Sara Tomko is an actor and CEO of In The Pocket Productions. She is most notably known as Asta Twelvetrees in the hit show Resident Alien. She is an actor, producer, poet, singer, artist, earring maker, thrift store seeker, and mental health advocate. You can find her on Instagram @saratomko19

Alan Tudyk

Multi-dimensional actor Alan Tudyk never fails to surprise us. He made us think in I, Robot, terrified us in Dollhouse, made us love him in Firefly and Serenity, and commiserate with him in Con Man. He is currently starring in Resident Alien. And that only skims the surface.

Alice Wetterlund

Alice Wetterlund is a stand-up comedian and actor who performs regularly at San Francisco's Punchline, LA's Largo, and The Hollywood Improv. You can see Wetterlund in Silicon Valley, People of Earth, and Resident Alien. Her special My Mama is a Human and So Am I is now streaming on Amazon Prime.

Back to Top

Announced: 07/24/2024

Atlanta Swing Orchestra

The Atlanta Swing Orchestra is a group of musicians that really love to play the big band music that gets you tearing up the dance floor! They are dedicated to keeping the Great American Songbook alive by playing tunes from the 30s and 40s to modern classics.

DJ Neon the Glowgobear

DJ Neon the Glowgobear has been the DJ and producer of the Spectrum party for over 10 years running.

Robert Hendrickson

Robert Hendrickson has created artwork for some of the largest brands in entertainment, Star Wars, The Walking Dead, The Lord of the Rings, Game of Thrones and more. Clients include, Lucasfilm, Disney, and New Line Cinema. He has produced artwork for over 15 years in the Star Wars Universe seen worldwide.

Babs Olusanmokun

Babs Olusanmokun is a Nigerian-American actor best known for playing Dr. Joseph M'Benga in Star Trek: Strange New Worlds (2022–present) and Jamis in Dune (2021) and Dune: Part Two (2024). He also appeared in the video game Max Payne 3 as Serrano, providing both acting and voice content.

DJ Scapegoat

Currently DJing various clubs and events in Glasgow, Scotland, Scapey is an alternative DJ who has been on the go since 1998.

The Faithful Sidekicks

The Faithful Sidekicks are a comedic geek folk-pop/filk duo who write and perform original catchy songs about fandoms, gaming, and technology who won the 2021 Best Performer Pegasus Award. They play fun songs with a ton of heart and a touch of snark for nerds, geeks, and fans of all kinds.

Back to Top

Announced: 07/23/2024

Kathleen O'Shea David

Kathleen O'Shea David started working with puppets at a young age. Along the way she has learned few more skills. Her puppets are in various collections. She is an equity stage manager with an MFA from Yale. She is a published writer and editor of various works.

Back to Top

Announced: 07/19/2024

TC Costello

For over a decade TC Costello has been bringing his Celtic steampunk music to the dive bars, street corners, and festivals of Europe, Asia, and the United States. The last few years have seen him playing on the streets of Dragon Con, and this year he is thrilled to finally play the stages of the happiest convention on earth.

Brett Dalton

Brett Dalton is an actor best known for playing Grant Ward and Hive in Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D., as well as Detective Mark Trent in the series Found, and Michael Munroe in the video game Until Dawn. He also provided the voice and motion capture for Freyr in God of War: Ragnarök.

Dallas Liu

Dallas Liu is an American actor who made his acting debut as young Jin Kazama in Tekken. He has gone on to appear in the television series PEN15 as Shuji Ishii-Peters and as Carter in Legendary Dudas. He portrays Prince Zuko in the Netflix series Avatar: The Last Airbender, a live-action remake of the animated series of the same name.

Jared Padalecki

Jared Padalecki is best known for playing the role of Sam Winchester in the TV series Supernatural. He rose to fame after appearing on the television series Gilmore Girls as well as the films New York Minute, Flight of the Phoenix, House of Wax, and Friday the 13th.

Andrew Robinson

Andrew Robinson has painted covers for all the major publishers, illustrating such titles as Batman Detective, Hawkman, Starman, Superman Rebirth, Ironman, Hydra, Star Wars, Black Panther, and The JSA. He is a multi-award winning, NY Times bestselling illustrator for his painted work on The Fifth Beatle.

Back to Top

Announced: 07/18/2024

Lindsay Hays

Dr. Lindsay Hays is the program scientist for the Astrobiology program and Mars Sample Return campaign lead scientist in the Planetary Science Division at NASA Headquarters.

Back to Top

Announced: 07/17/2024

Dustin Fletcher

Dustin Fletcher is a specialty costumer for film and television focusing on the superhero and horror genres and produces high quality Actual Plays with Elder Eye Entertainment.

Kathy Hunter

Kathy Hunter is a fiber artist, painter, costumer, musician, and technical support for the Kurt Hunter Marionettes. She is a seamstress with a great knowledge of fabrics, techniques, and color.

Back to Top

Announced: 07/16/2024

Andy Brown

Andy Brown is a CSC associate cinematographer and award winning director. Brown's vast experience has allowed him to develop a keen eye for creating stunning images and thought-provoking stories.

Raymond Daniel Carr

Raymond Carr is an Atlanta based Jim Henson Company puppeteer who has traveled to every major city in North America and parts of Europe working on multi-million dollar productions.

Cady Coleman

Cady Coleman, a former NASA astronaut who flew twice on the space shuttle and spent six months on the International Space Station, coached Sandra Bullock in Gravity and played a space duet with Jethro Tull. Her book is called Sharing Space: An Astronaut's Guide to Mission, Wonder, and Making Change.

Margaret Downey

Margaret Downey is best known at Dragon Con as the world's only friggatriskaidekaphobia treatment nurse. She developed the character in 1996. Downey has organized and implemented the Skeptics parade for 15 years. She is also a panelist at the Skeptrack and occasionally delivers presentations of interest to the Skeptic community.

Kurt Hunter

Kurtis is known for his innovative solo marionette work. In 2008 he received an UNIMA-USA Citation of Excellence and in 2018 was awarded a grant from the Jim Henson Foundation.

Greg Keyes

Greg Keyes is the author of 30+ novels, from original works to licensed universes including Star Wars, Babylon 5, Pacific Rim, Godzilla, and The Elder Scrolls.

Audrey Martin

Dr. Audrey Martin is a planetary scientist who studies the composition of asteroids and is a collaborator on NASA's Lucy mission. She is also a Walkabout the Galaxy podcast co-host!

ALAN J. PORTER

Alan J. Porter is a writer and podcaster. He has over 30 fiction and non-fiction book publishing credits and hundreds of magazine articles on multiple subjects.

Shadow Girls Cult

Shadow Girls Cult, co-founded in 2018 by Cass Bray and Zane Exactly, is a queer shadow puppetry and projections duo based in Seattle, WA.

RezMonk Walker

Award winning Kelly Sue DeConnick’s work spans stage, comics, film, and television. She is best known for Captain Marvel, Wonder Woman Historia: The Amazons, Bitch Planet, and Pretty Deadly. A founding partner at Good Trouble Productions, she has helped produce educational comics for NY Public Schools and Congressman John Lewis’s Run.

Barry Gordon

Barry Gordon became a fixture as a character actor in feature films and television, most prominently as a co-star on the hit series The New Dick Van Dyke Show, Fish, and Archie Bunker's Place. His voice was heard for decades as the Nestle Quik Bunny and he originated the voice of Donatello in Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.

Renae Jacobs

She is best known as the voice of April O'Neil in the animated series Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. Jacobs has been heard on numerous animated shows such as Rose Petal Place, Rose Petal Place: Real Friends, It's Punky Brewster!, My Little Pony, and Moon Dreamers.

Rob Paulsen

Emmy award winning Rob Paulsen voices some of the most well-known characters of all time, including Yakko Warner and Pinky (of Pinky and the Brain) on the Animaniacs, Raphael/Donatello in the TMNT, Arthur in The Tick, the title role in The Mask, Carl Wheezer in Jimmy Neutron, and many more!

Aliona Baranova

Aliona Baranova is a theatre trained actor and director, who has contributed to some of the most successful visual entertainment of the past 10 years. Jennifer English

Jennifer English trained as an actor at the Royal Birmingham conservatoire, with extensive experience across stage, screen, and video games. Her video game credits include projects such as Divinity: Original Sin II, Latenna in Elden Ring, and most recently as the iconic role of Shadowheart on Baldur's Gate III.

Neil Newbon

Neil Newbon has been an actor and director in performance capture and voiceover in games, television, and films for 14+ years in 130+ titles. He is known for his work as Astarion on Baldur's Gate III, Deliver Us Mars, Trailer Farms: Happy Together Borderlands 3 trailer, and Total War Three Kingdoms.

Theo Solomon

On screen, Theo Solomon appeared in ITV's Vera, Sky's Temple, and BBC's Enterprice. On stage, he played a lead in the Old Vic's Woyzeck, toured Hamlet, and performed the award winning play Shebeen in London and Nottingham. Most recently he has appeared as Wyll in the record breaking Baldur's Gate III.

Devora Wilde

Devora Wilde, BAFTA Breakthrough Longlist nominee 2022, is a Bulgarian-born actress who grew up in the UK. She plays one of the main origin characters, Lae'zel, in Baldur's Gate III from Larian Studios, as well as voicing characters in games such as Arknights, Battlefield 2042, and Total Warhammer III, among others.

Atlanta Radio Theatre Company

ARTC performs audio drama, both live and in the studio. We supply the story, the music, the sound effects, and the voices. The listener fills in all the other details with their imagination.

Eranga-D

Eranga D works as a freelance illustrator out of Birmingham, Alabama. He does cover and pinup work in the mainstream and indie comic market. In his time in comics, he has worked with Dark Horse, Dynamite, Scout Comics, Black Caravan, and contributed covers to several indie Kickstarters.

Adam Kubert

Adam Kubert began his career in comics at the age of 12, lettering for DC Comics. He is best known for his work at Marvel. Kubert's work includes the X-Men, Fantastic Four, The Incredible Hulk, Spider-Man, Avengers, Superman, Ghost Rider, and most notably, Wolverine.

Mikal Mosley

Mikal Mosley is an avid convention goer and costume designer. He has presented at several major conventions over the past 10 years, such as Dragon Con, MomoCon, and San Diego Comic Con. His professional costume credits include building costumes for the WWE, NFL, and various tv shows.

Bob Pendarvis

Bob Pendarvis was the original creator of SCAD's Sequential Art Department (he even named it) and taught dozens of unique classes for over 18 years. Pendarvis's most recent accomplishments are the successful publication of A Girl Teaching Art Classes in the Spooky Woods Near a Witch and the sequel James.
